importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article reflects the current timeline of the humanitarian crisis in Gaza, highlighting the ongoing struggle for food delivery under the ceasefire.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The crisis is ongoing in 2025, indicating a continuing humanitarian emergency that requires sustained international attention and intervention.

keyTakeAways: Food supplies to Gaza are still far below the WFP's daily target of 2,000 tonnes, with only 750 tonnes currently arriving daily.
Only two Israeli-controlled crossings—Karem Abu Salem and al-Karara—are currently operational, limiting access to humanitarian aid.
The US-brokered ceasefire is critical for allowing food deliveries and preventing famine, especially in northern Gaza.
The WFP has 26 food distribution points open in Gaza, up from five, but still far short of the 145 it aims to operate across the territory.
The Rafah border crossing remains closed until Hamas returns the bodies of deceased captives, further restricting aid access.
Hamas has pledged to hand over 28 captives’ remains, having delivered 13 so far, with two more confirmed for delivery on 2025-10-21.
Nutrition supplies for children and pregnant women have reached northern Gaza via southern routes, but at insufficient levels.
Gaza residents are storing food due to uncertainty about the duration of the ceasefire and future hostilities.
Current food supplies are sufficient for about half a million people for two weeks.

namedEntities.name: UN World Food Programme (WFP)
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A UN agency responsible for coordinating global food aid
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The WFP is central to the article as it directly reports on the current levels and challenges of food supply to Gaza.

namedEntities.name: Gaza Strip
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Palestinian territory located in the eastern Mediterranean
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Gaza is the primary location of the humanitarian crisis described, with food access and distribution being critical to its population's survival.

namedEntities.name: Karem Abu Salem
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A border crossing into Gaza from Israel
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: One of the only two operational crossings currently allowing food delivery into Gaza.

namedEntities.name: al-Karara (Kissufim)
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A border crossing into Gaza from Israel
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The second operational crossing, enabling food deliveries to the central and southern parts of Gaza.

namedEntities.name: Rafah border crossing
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A crossing between Gaza and Egypt
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Currently closed, which severely restricts humanitarian access to northern Gaza and limits potential supply routes.

namedEntities.name: Salah al-Din Street
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A major north-south street in Gaza
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The WFP has not been granted permission to use this main route, limiting access to northern Gaza areas.

namedEntities.name: Hamas
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Palestinian political and military organization
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Hamas is central to the conditions for reopening the Rafah crossing and the return of captives' bodies, which affects humanitarian access.

namedEntities.name: Israel
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A country that controls the main border crossings into Gaza
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Israel’s control over crossings and decisions on aid access is a key factor in the current humanitarian crisis.

namedEntities.name: Benjamin Netanyahu
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He has publicly stated that the Rafah crossing remains closed until Hamas hands over captives’ remains, directly impacting aid delivery.

namedEntities.name: Donald Trump
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He brokered the ceasefire, and his 20-point plan for ending the war includes provisions for full humanitarian aid to Gaza.

namedEntities.name: US
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The US played a pivotal role in brokering the ceasefire and promoting humanitarian access to Gaza.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The UN World Food Programme reports that daily food deliveries to Gaza are critically insufficient, with only 750 tonnes reaching the territory—far below the target of 2,000 tonnes—due to only two of the Israeli-controlled crossings being open. The WFP stresses that all border crossings must be fully utilized to meet food needs, particularly in northern Gaza. While humanitarian aid has expanded to 26 distribution points, this remains far below the planned 145. The Rafah crossing remains closed, and access is conditional on Hamas delivering the bodies of deceased captives. The US-brokered ceasefire is seen as vital to preventing famine, and the WFP warns that current food supplies are only sufficient for half a million people for two weeks, with residents storing food due to fears of renewed conflict.
title: WFP says food supplies to Gaza below targets, urges more crossings to open
